comments: As (0,0,1,12,97,...) this is the fourth binomial transform of cosh(x)-1. It is the binomial transform of A016269, when this has two leading zeros. Its e.g.f. is then exp(4x)cosh(x)-exp(4x). - _Paul Barry_, May 13 2003This gives the third column of the Sheffer triangle A143495 (3-restricted Stirling2 numbers). See the e.g.f. below, and A193685 for comments on the general case. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 08 2011
formula: a(n) = 5^(n+2)/2-4^(n+2)+3^(n+2)/2. - _Paul Barry_, May 13 2003If we define f(m,j,x)=sum(binomial(m,k)*stirling2(k,j)*x^(m-k),k=j..m) then a(n-2)=f(n,2,3), (n>=2). - _Milan Janjic_, Apr 26 2009a(n) = 9*a(n-1) -20*a(n-2) +3^n, n>=2. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Mar 20 2011O.g.f.: 1/((1-3*x)*(1-4*x)*(1-5*x)).E.g.f.: diff(exp(3*x)*((exp(x)-1)^2)/2!,x$2). - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 08 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
